questions.question: In what year did Elvis Presley first appear on The Ed Sullivan Show?
questions.funFact: Elvis appeared on the show three times in 1956-1957. His first appearance on September 9, 1956 drew about 60 million viewers — a record at the time!

questions.question: How much did a gallon of gasoline cost in the United States in 1960 (in cents)?
questions.funFact: In 1960, the average price of a gallon of gas was just 31 cents. That's about $3.20 adjusted for inflation today.

questions.question: How many episodes of I Love Lucy were produced during its original run (1951-1957)?
questions.funFact: I Love Lucy was the most-watched show in the United States for four of its six seasons and pioneered the three-camera setup still used in sitcoms today.

questions.question: In what year did the Beatles first appear on The Ed Sullivan Show?
questions.funFact: The Beatles appeared on February 9, 1964. An estimated 73 million Americans watched — about 34% of the entire U.S. population at the time!

questions.question: How much did a first-class U.S. postage stamp cost in 1960 (in cents)?
questions.funFact: The stamp price stayed at 4 cents from 1958 to 1963. Before that, it had been 3 cents since 1932!

questions.question: In what year was the original Disneyland theme park in Anaheim, California opened?
questions.funFact: Opening day on July 17, 1955 was famously chaotic — it was so hot that women's heels sank into the freshly poured asphalt, and many rides broke down.

questions.question: How many people attended the Woodstock music festival in August 1969?
questions.funFact: Originally planned for 50,000 people, Woodstock drew an estimated 400,000 attendees to Max Yasgur's dairy farm in Bethel, New York.

questions.question: How much did the average new car cost in the United States in 1955 (in dollars)?
questions.funFact: The average new car in 1955 cost about $1,910. That same year, the iconic Chevrolet Bel Air was one of the best-selling cars in America.

questions.question: In what year did Neil Armstrong walk on the Moon?
questions.funFact: On July 20, 1969, an estimated 600 million people worldwide watched on television as Armstrong took his famous first step.

questions.question: How much did a movie ticket cost on average in the United States in 1970 (in cents)?
questions.funFact: The average movie ticket in 1970 was about $1.55. That year's top films included Patton, MASH, and Love Story.

questions.question: How many seasons did the TV show Bonanza run (1959-1973)?
questions.funFact: Bonanza was one of the first TV series to be broadcast in color and ran for 431 episodes over 14 seasons on NBC.

questions.question: In what year did the last episode of M*A*S*H air, becoming the most-watched broadcast in TV history?
questions.funFact: The M*A*S*H finale on February 28, 1983 drew 105.9 million viewers, a record that stood for decades. The show ran for 11 seasons — far longer than the actual Korean War.

questions.question: How much did a loaf of bread cost on average in the United States in 1965 (in cents)?
questions.funFact: In 1965, a loaf of white bread cost about 21 cents. The minimum wage at the time was $1.25 per hour.

questions.question: What was the population of the United States in 1960 (in millions)?
questions.funFact: The 1960 census counted about 179 million Americans. By comparison, the country had about 150 million in 1950 and 203 million by 1970.

questions.question: In what year was the first color television broadcast in the United States?
questions.funFact: CBS broadcast the first commercial color TV program on June 25, 1951, but very few people owned color TVs. It wasn't until the mid-1960s that color TV became common in American homes.
